page.title: 08PADSTOW CAROLS
page.content: During the month of December, on Sunday evenings,and after Evening Service, a small group of people meet in Market Square to carry on the age-old tradition of singing the{ {Padstow Carols.}The Carols are a collection of songs,many unique to Padstow,which are now,thankfully, published by a local-born printer on his press in Padstow so that they are in no danger of being lost. Having sung two or three of the Carols in the Square the group,by now joined by more people,move off around the town singing one of the Carols at a street corner or outside the house of an older Padstow resident who might not otherwise have a chance of hearing them.On Christmas Eve the singers walk up to Prideaux Place where they sing to the Prideaux-Brune family,who have lived there for over 300 years.
